Hartford, Dec. 12/82. My Dear Judge Russell-
Woodford [illeg.] wrote me, & I answered; result, this arrangement:
5 th Regular toast: Woman — God bless her! Response by Mark Twain.
You see, I never use any name but my nom de guerre on public occasions.)
Woodford says that if President a A rthur is not on hand, I'll be No. 5 — otherwise I am to be No. 6. It gives me the belly-ache to wait long with a speech in my bowels.

I threw aside all my other sub- jects — they were too solemn. As this is to be my last speech, with the exception of one next August which is to fulfill a promise 3 years old, I thought I would like to wind up with an obituary with the right amount of non- sense in it.
